title: (x) Whistlin' Dixie script in Vanity Fair - VF Script {Chester, Stephen}
content:

 [‹ Please help to id this font - bold comic-like price tag](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422033233/http:/typophile.com/node/14273 "Go to previous forum topic") [Old font for ID ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422033233/http:/typophile.com/node/14317 "Go to next forum topic")
author: oliviersada

comments.content: Well, I don’t know what it is, but maybe take a look at [FF Jackie](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422033233/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FF.11393.0.0).

It’s... Vanity Fair. Anybody out there know anybody working at VF? It seems to me they use a mix of published and custom typefaces, and I’ve never seen this script anywhere else. (Alas, I don’t get around much any more.)
[James Montalbano](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422033233/http:/terminaldesign.com/custom_mag_vanFair_02.shtml) did the Vanity Fair fonts and I think it’s his best work.
_Et voilà,_ that’s the beauty of the Type Identification Board. It’s so wikkidly efficient — I love it! Great job, Chester and Stewf! :)
